abstract: How do you go from being one of the country’s most-renowned and respected business leaders to landing on the list of the Worst C.E.O.’s of 2011? With arrogance, complacency and bumbling, says Sydney Finkelstein, an author and professor at Dartmouth College.
snippet: How do you go from being one of the country’s most-renowned and respected business leaders to landing on the list of the Worst C.E.O.’s of 2011? With arrogance, complacency and bumbling, says Sydney Finkelstein, an author and professor at Dartmout...
lead_paragraph: Sydney Finkelstein is a professor of strategy and leadership at the Tuck School of Business at Dartmouth College and the author of the bestselling book “Why Smart Executives Fail.”
